key_responsibilities: to manage and coordinate all communications activities, including media contacts, for the Member and the office
requirements: at least 2 years of congressional experience and one year of experience as a Communications Director or Press Secretary
strong writing, editing, and proofreading skills
understanding of print and broadcast media with a current working list of Washington and national media contacts
knowledge of current issues and events in which the Member is involved
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member's positions on policy issues
ability to work well under pressure
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with office staff, constituents, and media.

key_responsibilities: handle press inquiries, speech-writing, social media, and message development and strategy for both Washington and the District
working with our communications team to coordinate and execute the Member’s overall communication efforts
requirements: thrive in a fast-moving, aggressive communications environment
be team-oriented, nimble, creative and strategic

office: A Western Republican member of Congress
key_responsibilities: Support the Representative’s legislative priorities through legislative research, the drafting of legislation, acting as the liaison to the relevant committees, work with the Congressional Research Service, and identifying strategies to advance those legislative priorities
Prepare the member for committee hearings, staff those hearings and monitor/report to the Representative at times when he is unable to attend the meeting
Assist the Representative in preparing for interviews, meetings with constituents and interest groups, as well as note taking at such meetings and follow up action items
Draft answers or prepare outlines of responses to constituent mail
Draft speeches, statements and correspondence with the appropriate executive agencies for review by the Legislative Director, Chief of Staff, and the Representative

Develop and justify co-sponsorship and vote recommendations for review by the Legislative Director and Chief of Staff and for consideration by the Representative for bills in committee, mark up and on the floor in assigned areas of responsibility.

coordinating with the legislative team to develop, manage and organize all communications activities, including writing press releases, op-eds, mail pieces, talking points, organizing press events, maintaining the official website, implementing social media strategy, maintaining press database, writing e-newsletters & coordinating Tele-town halls
briefing the Member for interviews, writing and implementing PSAs, interacting with the press as the Member’s principal spokesperson and coordinating the Member’s overall press relations
requirements: proven ability to manage multiple communications projects
ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment in the representation of the Member’s position on policy issues
a depth of legislative and policy knowledge including that of the appropriations process

office: Rep. Elijah E. Cummings, the Ranking Member, Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
key_responsibilities: participate in all matters under the Committee’s jurisdiction, including investigations, hearings, depositions, transcribed interviews, and briefings
requirements: attorney with 2-5 years of investigative or litigation experience
ability to work well under pressure
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: develop strategies to increase outreach to LES and represent the office at public meetings

office: Democratic Staff of the House Committee on Small Business
key_responsibilities: handle matters including but not limited to agency oversight, procurement, financial services, health, and/or technology
hearing preparation and legislative development
greeting visitors, answering the telephone, scheduling tours and responding to constituent requests for general information and other inquiries
monitors delivery and pickup of materials, maintains the front office, and assists with various administrative duties
requirements: maintain a good relationship with the Member, staff and constituents
accept performance based criticism and direction
prepared to work a flexible schedule

key_responsibilities: oversee management and operation of two District offices
serve as a key liaison to local organizations and elected officials
develop and implement long-term strategic plans
requirements: strong oral and written communications skills
self-motivation and outreach experience to local and state organizations
a thorough understanding of the federal legislative process and in-depth knowledge of Southern CA
ability to multi-task, work well under pressure and the flexibility to work long hours, including nights and weekends
